question: Which Indian-Origin leader has recently become the longest- serving MP in the House of Commons, United Kingdom?
explanation: Keith Vaz has become the longest-serving Indian-origin MP in the House of Commons. He has announced his retirement from Parliament after 32 years in the wake of a drug scandal. Mr. Vaz had been the Labour Partyâ€™s MP for Leicester East since 1987 but announced that he would not be seeking re-election in the December 12 General Election.
